IX.iii.1.J.1.c
.
When to Consider the Net Worth of the Child
The net worth of the child of a Veteran or surviving spouse can also be a factor for current-law pension purposes.  However, do not add the child’s net worth to that of the payee.  Evaluate the child’s net worth independently and if the child’s net worth is excessive, remove the child from the award, per
38 CFR 3.274(d)
, regardless of whether removing the child and their income results in a higher rate of pension.  Evaluate the child’s net worth using the applicable net worth rules for dates of claim either before, on or after October 18, 2018.
Example
:  A Veteran files an original pension claim on November 25, 2018.  The Veteran has a 13-year-old biological son that inherited $250,000 in stocks during 2015.
Result
:  Because the child’s net worth is over $123,600, do not establish the child as a dependent.
Reference
:  For more information on the net worth of children, see
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, 1.J.1.d
.
